Binary Tree¶

class Balanced_binary_tree.BalancedSearchTree(size=16)¶

Balanced Search Tree usage: bs.BalancedSearchTree

call bs.insert to add int to tree call bs.insertlist to add a whole list to tree
Todo:create a better print function for displaying tree
balance(tree=[])¶
Description:balance makes use of the fact we are using a list to store our tree. It sorts the list first, then uses the built in insert function to reapply the values in a more balanced order.
Parameters:tree (list) – list that holds the values of self.tree
Returns:none
extend()¶
Description:extends the size of the list when a value will not fit in current tree
Returns:none
find(key)¶
Parameters:key (int) – the value to be found
Returns:if the key was found or not
Return type:bool
insert(val)¶
Parameters:val (int) – value to insert into tree
Returns:none
insertlist(inlist=[])¶
Parameters:inlist (list) – the list to be inserted if no value is given assumes an empty list
Returns:none
leftchild(i)¶
rightchild(i)¶
